title: I think Naut using his anchor on walls should be promoted
body:
Methinks that the mana cost on Nauts hook should be refunded if he uses it on walls as a mobility spell. If not, at least refund half the cost.

That way if I'm trying to compete with some of those champions with 9994984894891759817648975911 base movespeed (slight exaggeration) heading towards objectives I don't go OOM trying to get there.

It'll calm down eventually, once the boards get sick of clamoring for moblity nerfs, but it'll come back as well. Never will somebody be able to think of Lee Sin and Zed without including Kalista in there as well, no matter what Riot does to her. 

I played Riven a lot in season two and three. For the longest time, people just considered her another toplaner. She was strong, but if you played well, you could burst her down. She had perceived strengths and weaknesses. 

Then, out of nowhere, Faker decided to take her mid as a Zed counter. Suddenly, every jerkwad and his asshole mother picked up Riven, bought the Battlebunny skin, and proceeded to flame and rage and feed every game. Riven became one of those "champs that only assholes play." But she was also extremely fun to play, and eventually she was popular enough to become one of those "OP faceroll easy champions." Literally nothing in her kit or numbers had changed, just her perceived strength. 

The circlejerk lasted until Riot finally nerfed her early game by a good deal and her HP regen to practically nothing. Yet remnants of that unreasonable and unstoppable hatred still linger today. Being a mobile champion, she's currently a scapegoat for the whole "mobility is cancer, everyone should be as slow as Swain" circlejerk. Such is life on the boards.

Kalista's mobility, while not really that OP until she hits late game with Ruunans, is not exactly healthy gameplay in my opinion.

Pick/win rate is never a solid way to judge a champion's power (unless it's an insane outlier, like Azir, or Warwick before his nerfs this season).

And believe me, free, instant mobility that is given upon a champion's most basic ability and Q is *extremely* bad. If she is capable of infinitely kiting melee champions that are designed to hunt people down, I think there is a problem there.

I occasionally hear mudslinging about Thresh and Blitz, but not very often.

People will complain about a lot of things, to be honest.

I complain about Blitz all the time :I I do not like that his Grab is instant death. Not because you were pulled (although thats part of it) but because from the moment he pulls you til you die you are CC'd and can do nothing about it, all because he landed 1 skill shot :( and he can do it like every 20 seconds. The only fair thing about it is it uses up his entire kit.

That's his issue though. Early game it has a very heavy mana cost (120 mana at level 1. Can't even do like 3-4 pulls early on), and it's the only way he's going to unleash all of his damage unless he runs up to you and E's. I don't want to resort to "just dodge the spear", but it's the only thing in his kit that can initiate safely. If he tries to run up to you, punish him for it. Try to out juke the Q if possible.

I'm not entirely solid on how to give good advice against him. But dodging his Q is pretty much the best and only way to win against Blitz. If he misses, punish him severely for it, because it won't be back up for a while.

Oh, and don't underestimate his ult, ESPECIALLY if he's building AP. If he's AD, make sure he doesn't walk up and E (again, avoid pull if possible).

I dodge his Q's most of the time in lane, but in teamfights its hard to manage minions, him, and the rest of his team. Then he just pull, knock-up, silences you and then 20 seconds later he will do it again.

I also think that the wall anchor thing is such a great part of Nautilus' kit but isn't utilized enough.

I agree with the notion that we should give people more of an incentive to use his Q on walls. Even with the cooldown refund, it's too costly in terms of mana and cooldown to be used on a regular basis. It's actually very rarely used at all.

EDIT: No huge buffs, really. Last time Riot gave him like 5 armor and he became instant FoTM. I'm just saying that using your hook is just so unsatisfying. You move a tiny distance even with max range anchor and it has a delay in which you stand still and it costs a lot of mana. Maybe even compensation nerfs if the walljump buffs were excessive.
Yes BUFF mobility. We need more mobility buffs in this game.

Hm? Naut's mobility spell is tied to a skillshot - and unlike Lee Sin or Vi, he doesn't have either the high base movespeed or the second dash to make landing his skillshot easier. Nautilus is probably the least mobile "mobile" champion in the game, which is further expounded by the fact that his mobility does not go through walls, is not targeted, and is on a higher cooldown (when used on champions) than most nonultimate mobility spells in the game. If you ask me, the problem is that most mobile champions have high kill potential and set up their own kills using that mobility - Naut can set up kills for his team, but not for himself. The problem isn't inherently mobility.

This change also wouldn't affect Nautilus' mobility in relation to using it to affect champions - it doesn't improve his ganks, it simply makes it so he can traverse the map without running himself out of mana. I think it's good, because it compensates him for being pretty much the only melee in the game with such low base movespeed.

mana buffs would not break Naut, he's still gated by cooldowns and a lack of sustain compared to AD champs just by virtue of lifesteal being OP

besides, hooking to a wall has some obvious counterplay that I've encountered on numerous occasions (jerk enemies getting in the way)
